title: California MEANS TEST Question RE: 401K withdrawals before filing Chapter 7
question: Are 401K withdrawals considered income under the Means Test in California? Total withdrawals of $5,000- $6000 each for the last 6 months but the money in the 401K is now all gone. Do these amounts have to be included in Means Test? (Will not pass Means Test if they were to be included as income). No other income for at least the last 8 months since losing job. All money was used to pay for living expenses. :(
answers:
First, as a technical matter of law, I would state any earned interest or portion of an employers contribution to such 401k could be deemed income, otherwise it would not be part of the test. Why? Because if for example you earned $2000 and put in 401k , then withdrew within 6 months and filed bankruptcy would you use $4000 ($2000 earned and $2000 withdrawn)? No. You only earned $2000! Otherwise, I agree with the other answers already provided!

Second, other issues and facts can gravely affect your case and you asking that question implies you have not spoken to an experienced CA Bankruptcy attorney and that is a big mistake so I will point out some of those issues now so you realize such mistake in not discussing in person with such an attorney.

You need and want to enjoy your fresh start also. But the most important thing is to meet with an attorney as you asking this question means you have not. You care about 2 goals: keeping everything you have equity in and discharging all your debts. If you don't have any of the exceptions to discharge you will obtain that goal; most exceptions are set forth in 11 USC. 523 (Google it) like child support, some income taxes, traffic (in a ch 7) and criminal fines , and presumption of student loans. But some debts are dischargeable in a ch 13 but NOT in a ch 7 so you want to make sure and your attorney will discuss any such types with you also!

Your exemptions depend on what state you have lived in in the last 2 years and thus if in your state, then your states exemptions will apply. Most persons filing keep everything they own but your attorney will confirm that with you when they learn everything you own and the equity thereof!

Some secured debts like homes, vehicles, other secured debts an attorney will discuss your options on also as you must list any debts; but that does not mean you will lose them unless you have too much equity or are in default on paying for them! Discuss those options if they apply with your attorney too.

But other issues can arise that can greatly harm your case. Just one example: If you paid back a relative $3,000 11 months ago and now file bankruptcy next week, the trustee can SUE that relative to retrieve that $3,000 (under what is called a preference) for the benefit of the bankruptcy estate. As a result, most attorneys don't charge to meet with them the first meeting so meet with one no matter what.

Many great attorneys can be found right here on AVVO in your state so look, call, and meet one as soon as you can.

You should also want to know when to file: is there an advantage of waiting versus filing now and who should you pay between now and then! Good luck and enjoy your later fresh start.

Income for purposes of the Means Test is new money. Money in a 401k is your money in your account. Withdrawals from a 401k may have tax consequences but should not be counted as income for the Means Test.

Even if your 401k withdrawals are counted as income you have good argument under In re Lanning that since you've used up the available source of funds that that "income" will no longer exist in the future so that the change is either known or virtually certain to occur so that the means test gives an erroneous result. Consult with a local bk attorney or two.

Income does not include withdrawals from retirement accounts especially since the balance is now zero.. The Means Test is designed to show income going forward as well as what you "earned" in the past six months. There is a place for you to show your expectation of future income/expense changes. A good Avvo BK lawyer is needed to help you sort this out. Some of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it.

But since you're post was placed by random position, I'm going to say I doubt that this is going to kill visit come because you already earned it. I will go ahead and put this in the correct category.
